sect3.title: Program Files
sect3.para: efm_filter.pl, efm_perl.pl, ex (link to vim), less.sh, mve.awk, pltags.pl, ref, rview (link to vim), rvim (link to vim), shtags.pl, tcltags, vi (link to vim), view (link to vim), vim, vim132, vim2html.pl, vimdiff (link to vim), vimm, vimspell.sh, vimtutor and xxd

sect4.title: efm_filter.pl
sect4.para: efm_filter.pl is a filter which reads from stdin, copies to stdout and creates an error file that can be read by vim.

sect4.title: efm_perl.pl
sect4.para: efm_perl.pl reformats the error messages of the Perl interpreter for use with the quickfix mode of vim.

sect4.title: ex
sect4.para: ex starts vim in Ex mode.

sect4.title: less.sh
sect4.para: less.sh is a script which starts vim with less.vim.

sect4.title: mve.awk
sect4.para: mve.awk processes vim errors.

sect4.title: pltags.pl
sect4.para: pltags.pl creates a tags file for Perl code, for use by vim.

sect4.title: ref
sect4.para: ref checks the spelling of arguments.

sect4.title: rview
sect4.para: rview is a restricted version of view. No shell commands can be started and vim can't be suspended.

sect4.title: rvim
sect4.para: rvim is the restricted version of vim. No shell commands can be started and vim can't be suspended.

sect4.title: shtags.pl
sect4.para: shtags.pl generates a tag file for perl scripts.

sect4.title: tcltags
sect4.para: tcltags generates a tag file for TCL code.

sect4.title: vi
sect4.para: vi starts vim in vi-compatible mode.

sect4.title: view
sect4.para: view starts vim in read-only mode.

sect4.title: vim
sect4.para: vim starts vim in the normal, default way.

sect4.title: vim132
sect4.para: vim132 starts vim with the terminal in 132 column mode.

sect4.title: vim2html.pl
sect4.para: vim2html.pl converts vim documentation to HTML.

sect4.title: vimdiff
sect4.para: vimdiff edits two or three versions of a file with vim and show differences.

sect4.title: vimm
sect4.para: vimm enables the DEC locator input model on a remote terminal.

sect4.title: vimspell.sh
sect4.para: vimspell.sh is a script which spells a file and generates the syntax statements necessary to highlight in vim.

sect4.title: vimtutor
sect4.para: vimtutor starts the Vim tutor.

sect4.title: xxd
sect4.para: xxd makes a hexdump or does the reverse.
